speaker: BENEDICK
text: Pray thee, sweet Mistress Margaret, deserve

speaker: BENEDICK
text: well at my hands by helping me to the speech of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Beatrice.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Will you then write me a sonnet in praise

speaker: MARGARET
text: of my beauty?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: In so high a style, Margaret, that no man

speaker: BENEDICK
text: living shall come over it, for in most comely truth

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thou deservest it.

speaker: MARGARET
text: To have no man come over me? Why, shall I

speaker: MARGARET
text: always keep below stairs?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Thy wit is as quick as the greyhound’s

speaker: BENEDICK
text: mouth; it catches.

speaker: MARGARET
text: And yours as blunt as the fencer’s foils,

speaker: MARGARET
text: which hit but hurt not.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: A most manly wit, Margaret; it will not hurt

speaker: BENEDICK
text: a woman. And so, I pray thee, call Beatrice. I give

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thee the bucklers.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Give us the swords; we have bucklers of our

speaker: MARGARET
text: own.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: If you use them, Margaret, you must put in

speaker: BENEDICK
text: the pikes with a vice, and they are dangerous

speaker: BENEDICK
text: weapons for maids.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Well, I will call Beatrice to you, who I

speaker: MARGARET
text: think hath legs.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: And therefore will come.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I mean in singing. But in loving, Leander the good

speaker: BENEDICK
text: swimmer, Troilus the first employer of panders, and

speaker: BENEDICK
text: a whole book full of these quondam carpetmongers,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: whose names yet run smoothly in the even

speaker: BENEDICK
text: road of a blank verse, why, they were never so truly

speaker: BENEDICK
text: turned over and over as my poor self in love. Marry,

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I cannot show it in rhyme. I have tried. I can find out

speaker: BENEDICK
text: no rhyme to “lady” but “baby”—an innocent

speaker: BENEDICK
text: rhyme; for “scorn,” “horn”—a hard rhyme; for

speaker: BENEDICK
text: “school,” “fool”—a babbling rhyme; very ominous

speaker: BENEDICK
text: endings. No, I was not born under a rhyming

speaker: BENEDICK
text: planet, nor I cannot woo in festival terms.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Sweet Beatrice, wouldst thou come when I called

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thee?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Yea, signior, and depart when you bid me.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: O, stay but till then!

speaker: BEATRICE
text: “Then” is spoken. Fare you well now. And

speaker: BEATRICE
text: yet, ere I go, let me go with that I came, which is,

speaker: BEATRICE
text: with knowing what hath passed between you and

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Claudio.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Only foul words, and thereupon I will kiss

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thee.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Foul words is but foul wind, and foul wind is

speaker: BEATRICE
text: but foul breath, and foul breath is noisome. Therefore

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I will depart unkissed.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Thou hast frighted the word out of his right

speaker: BENEDICK
text: sense, so forcible is thy wit. But I must tell thee

speaker: BENEDICK
text: plainly, Claudio undergoes my challenge, and either

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I must shortly hear from him, or I will subscribe

speaker: BENEDICK
text: him a coward. And I pray thee now tell me, for

speaker: BENEDICK
text: which of my bad parts didst thou first fall in love

speaker: BENEDICK
text: with me?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: For them all together, which maintained so

speaker: BEATRICE
text: politic a state of evil that they will not admit any

speaker: BEATRICE
text: good part to intermingle with them. But for which

speaker: BEATRICE
text: of my good parts did you first suffer love for me?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Suffer love! A good epithet. I do suffer love

speaker: BENEDICK
text: indeed, for I love thee against my will.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: In spite of your heart, I think. Alas, poor

speaker: BEATRICE
text: heart, if you spite it for my sake, I will spite it for

speaker: BEATRICE
text: yours, for I will never love that which my friend

speaker: BEATRICE
text: hates.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Thou and I are too wise to woo peaceably.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: It appears not in this confession. There’s not

speaker: BEATRICE
text: one wise man among twenty that will praise

speaker: BEATRICE
text: himself.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: An old, an old instance, Beatrice, that lived

speaker: BENEDICK
text: in the time of good neighbors. If a man do not erect

speaker: BENEDICK
text: in this age his own tomb ere he dies, he shall live no

speaker: BENEDICK
text: longer in monument than the bell rings and the

speaker: BENEDICK
text: widow weeps.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: And how long is that, think you?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Question: why, an hour in clamor and a

speaker: BENEDICK
text: quarter in rheum. Therefore is it most expedient for

speaker: BENEDICK
text: the wise, if Don Worm, his conscience, find no

speaker: BENEDICK
text: impediment to the contrary, to be the trumpet of

speaker: BENEDICK
text: his own virtues, as I am to myself. So much for

speaker: BENEDICK
text: praising myself, who, I myself will bear witness, is

speaker: BENEDICK
text: praiseworthy. And now tell me, how doth your

speaker: BENEDICK
text: cousin?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Very ill.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: And how do you?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Very ill, too.

speaker: BENEDICK
text: Serve God, love me, and mend. There will I

speaker: BENEDICK
text: leave you too, for here comes one in haste.

speaker: URSULA
text: Madam, you must come to your uncle. Yonder’s

speaker: URSULA
text: old coil at home. It is proved my Lady Hero

speaker: URSULA
text: hath been falsely accused, the Prince and Claudio

speaker: URSULA
text: mightily abused, and Don John is the author of all,

speaker: URSULA
text: who is fled and gone. Will you come presently?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Will you go hear this news, signior?

speaker: BENEDICK
text: I will live in thy heart, die in thy lap, and be

speaker: BENEDICK
text: buried in thy eyes—and, moreover, I will go with

speaker: BENEDICK
text: thee to thy uncle’s.
